Package  Class  Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator

Interface Summary
Controller The Controller interface should be implemented by any class whose instances are intended to be executed by a thread and perform real-time manipulation of an object.
 

Class Summary
AboutWindow The AboutWindow class represents a dialog window that conveys information about the WSU Kephera Simulator.
Collision The Collision class provides methods to check for a collision between the robot and an object in the simulated environment.
CurrentRobotState The CurrentRobotState class represents the current state of the robot at any time.
DirectoryClassLoader A DirectoryClassLoader is a utility class that provides the ablility to dynamically load a class from a directory in the file system.
DrawableRobot A DrawableRobot class provides methods to calculate a new position of the robot based on the current state of the robot
HelpDialog A HelpDialog object provides a means to view the html documentation of the WSU Kephera Simulator within the application.
KSClient A KSClient provides the functionality to connect to a server simulator and playback the currently running controller on that server.
KSFrame A KSFrame is the WSU Kephera Simulator's main GUI component.
KSGripperStates Contains static definitions for gripper/arm states.
KSMain Contains the main method.
KSReader A KSReader provides the functionality to read a recorded simulation from file and play it back to the local simulator.
KSReadWriteHeader The KSReadWriteHeader class is used by the KSWriter and KSReader classes when serializing and deserializing header information associated with recorded files.
KSReadWriteState The KSReadWriteState class is used by the KSWriter and KSReader classes when serializing and deserializing robot and world state information associated with recorded files.
KSServer A KSServer provides the functionality to listen for and service multiple clients.
KSServerWorker A KSServerWorker provides the functionality to service a client.
KSWriter A KSWriter class provides the functionality to plug into the local simulator and record the current running controller to a playable file.
Motor A Motor class represents a motor of the Kephera robot.
MyPoint A generic class to represent a 2-dimensional point.
ObjectDialog An ObjectDialog class provides the GUI components and functionality to create maps with a variety of objects such as walls, balls, caps, and lights.
ObjectPanel The ObjectPanel defines a panel used to display the set of objects that can be added to the world.
OptionsWindow An OptionsWindow class represents the options window of the application.
RobotController A RobotController is an abstract class that should be extended by any controller written for the WSU Kephera Simulator.
RobotControllerDirector A RobotControllerDirector is a utility class used to load, manage, and unload controllers that extend RobotController.
RobotCoordinates The RobotCoordinates class represents the current coordinates and direction of the robot.
RobotStatePanel The RobotStatePanel is a GUI component that shows the current status of the robot gripper, arm, and the object presence sensor.
Sensor A Sensor class represents one infared sensor of the Kephera robot.
StatusBar Representation of a generic status bar for an application.
UpdateRobotImage An UpdateRobotImage class provides the functionality to update the robots image.
UpdateSensors An UpdateSensors class provides the ability to update the sensor values of the robot based on the robot's environment, and its position/orientation in that environment.
Vertex This class defines a drawable object.
WorldDrawManager A WorldDrawManager class provides the main thread to run the simulator engine.
WorldPanel The WorldPanel class implements a custom JPanel for drawing world objects and robot animations.
